summary: This bill, the Housing Promotes Livelihood and Ultimate Success Act of 2025 (Housing PLUS Act), amends the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act to allow the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to award grants to entities requiring wraparound services (counseling, job training, etc.) or applying certain preconditions (sobriety, etc.). It mandates that at least 50% of Continuum of Care funds be used for entities offering wraparound services and requires the Secretary to report annually to Congress on compliance with these provisions.
